meanings.definition: Of or relating to an adjective.
meanings.sent2: In English, we often use adjectival phrases to add detail.
meanings.sent3: The adjectival colors on the painting made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: Her adjectival choice of words painted a vivid picture in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The adjectival descriptions in the book were so vivid that I felt like I was there.

meanings.definition: Having the nature of an adjective.
meanings.sent1: The adjectival function of this word is to modify a noun.
meanings.sent2: She used an adjectival phrase to make her writing more interesting.
meanings.sent3: His adjectival sense of humor always lightens the mood.
meanings.sent4: The adjectival power of music can evoke strong emotions.
meanings.sent5: The adjectival beauty of the sunset took my breath away.
